page.title: 09Churches of Woodham Ferrers
page.content: The parish church of St Mary the Virgin dates from the Norman conquest. The Rector who lives in the village, conducts Sunday services and also takes Communion to sick and elderly folk as needed. Its picturesque appearance and setting make it a popular choice for village weddings and christening and for those from the nearby new town. Traditionally too, local residents' funerals are held here followed by interment in the churchyard or, increasingly, cremation in Chelmsford. The congregational church (The Chapel) serves those who prefer free church forms of worship. Two Sunday services and Sunday school for children are held each week with additional meetings for children, women and bible study. Sick and elderly villagers receive gifts from the Communion fund at harvest time.
